alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 09 at 1:22PM PST until March 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches with up to 3 feet over higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with up to 2 feet in higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, areas north of Mount McLoughlin, including portions of Highway 62. For the Winter Weather Advisory, all other areas including portions of Highways 140, 66, and Interstate 5 at Siskiyou Summit. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall accumulation rates may briefly approach 1 inch per hour along Interstate 5 late Thursday afternoon. Rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely in the vicinity of Crater Lake. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
